name: Hotel Granados 83

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights with husband, went with it due to price we found including breakfast and reviews on here. All reviews are pretty as it was, very stylish almost aloof. Room a decent size loved the shutters which really aided sleep. there was some noise from above and beside but not enough to cause a problem. Breakfast had a great range to eat and was the best start to the day before embarking on a lot of walking. I wsa slightly unerved by the security instructions given on checking in, I know barcelona is known for pick pockets but not sure if this was totally necessary. Also pool not really a pool but roof top bar a nice place to enjoy a drink before going out. Plenty of places local to grab a bite to eat and it a really nice safe area.
reviews.title: Little hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately stay again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, convenient location, compact but efficient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice property within a 10-15 minute walk of the main tourist area (Las Ramblas). Close to the Diagonal and Provencal metro stops in case you prefer to use the metro. There's a large street project going on near the hotel which closed the street in front of the property, but the work only happened during the 8am-10pm hours, so no issue with sleeping. Nice rooftop lounge, but the pool was not meant for swimming at all... it seemed no bigger than a hot tub (but it was unheated). Guestrooms were small but stylish. Beds were a little short for my 6'2" travel companion, but they were comfortable enough. The shower was great!
reviews.title: Modern hotel but needs more comforts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a week during our vacation in Barcelona. First the positives. The hotel is quite well located on a quiet street. It is about a 10 minute walk to Passage de Gracia and about 20 minute walk to Placa Catalunya and La Ramblas. A metro station a block away. The staff is friendly and responsive and speak English pretty well for the most part.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable
Wow Wow & Wow
reviews.text: The cons. They advertise that they have an exercise facility and a pool . The exercise room was tiny with room for 2 bikes. The pool is the size of hot tub and is not heated. There is no business center but there is a computer available for use. The room has very modern decor but is missing what we thought were some important elements. There was no table or chair or lamps. There was a small couch but the room in our opinion need more furnishings. The room is on the tight side with no place to put luggage for 2 people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Granados 83, so we definitely liked it well enough to return. Location is hard to beat. Right in the middle of the Eixample area with lots of dining options in walking distance. While rooms are small, they are so well laid out that you don't even notice. They have a restful color scheme with lots of dark wood, the obligatory flat screen tv on the wall but behind a sliding panel. The bathroom was stark white with all the modern trappings and nice amenities all kitted out in a little zippered case, presumably to just slip in your 1 quart, see through, zip lock bag for airplane travel.
reviews.title: Great Eixample Boutique Hotel

likes.disliked: — High cost of breakfast, relatively speaking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff was helpful with dining reservations and recommended the Windsor, where we had the best (non tapas) meal of our trip. We've never eaten in the hotel's own restaurant, except for breakfast, which is lovely but a bit pricey, but the space is certainly pleasing. All in all, we could find nothing to quibble about with this place and a great deal to like, especially the value when you book one of the rooms for an off-season February visit. BTW Barcelona is a terrific European destination at that time of year with temps in the high 50s and even 60s permitting lunchtime outdoor dining.
reviews.title: I am so curious about the fried eggs!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just come back from a 5-day trip to Barcelona, in which I stayed at Hotel Granados 83. The hotel is located 2 blocks from a metro station and 3 blocks from Passeig de Gracia, where you find fancy shops and Gaudi’s buildings La Pedrera and Casa Batlló. It is situated in a very quiet street, but do not expect a deep silence, because any sound from the corridor echoes loudly into the room and this is, in my opinion, Granado 83’s greatest weakness.
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the positive side, staff is very professional and helpful (well, except for a lady in the reception to whom I asked where I could buy the same quilt they use in the hotel – a really beautiful one – and she said that was classified information…).
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room is spotless, with tasteful modern décor, good bathrooms and excellent free wireline internet connection, what makes it a perfect place for business travelers (most of the guests I met seemed to be traveling on business). However, if you are on holidays, you may want to stay at a hotel nearer Plaça de Catalunya and La Rambla, which is about 10 blocks from Granados 83.
reviews.title: Your reservation may be worthless!!!!

We stayed only one night, but it was amazing and they offered us room 209 that has a huge terrace with a small pool. We didn't use many of their other services but the front desk staff was extremely helpful and the location fabulous. We lived in Barcelona for 5 years and this is one of our favorite streets.

reviews.text: The bedrooms are a good size and well equipped - leather sofa, comfortable bed, big bathroom with power shower, small porthole window, and smart sliding doors which reveal the TV, Internet point and warddrobe. Wooden floors and exposed brick give the room that trendy loft feel.
reviews.title: I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.text: The rooms are well described on the Hotel website (look there for full details & pics) , but I'd summarize it as "Design" styling, but with enough wood and leather to avoid being cold. Absolutely spotlessly clean, with a huge and powerful shower (no bath - at least in rm 511). Plus a few antiques spread about to break up the shiny surfaces.
reviews.title: Great style and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good breakfast buffet + a la carte eggs/bacon etc. available - but check whether it is included in your rate.
reviews.title: Great hotel - you just need earplugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only one minor niggle - the heating/ac was slightly noisier than ideal. But Barcelona was such a lovely temperature in Dec that we just turned it off anyway.

likes.disliked: — bit of a walk but ok once you knew your way into the centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Granados 83 in October 2008. After searching many sites and reviews we agreed on the Granados due to its location and design qualities. I checked the booking before we arrived and the receptionist was very polite and friendly. When we arrived we had a similar greeting and were impressed by the look and feel of the hotel. We were given one of the disabled rooms on the ground floor which although very nice felt a bit claustrophobic with a view onto the inner coutyard which was not private. We had booked a city view room. We went back to reception and were told that they were fully booked. They offered us a free upgrade to a superior room for our second night which we accepted. Later that night we received an apology from the manager with free bubbly and strawberries! Our new room was actually smaller but had a balcony at the back of the hotel with a view onto backs of apartments. Saying this, we did enjoy our stay and would recommend Granados 83. The staff were friendly and professional, the rooms were more than adequate and the general design and ambiance beautiful. Make sure you get what you have booked though and dont let them fob you off with something else!
reviews.title: Great Designer Hotel

likes.liked: — The whole thought out design aspect and the staff
likes.disliked: — Shower water flooding onto the floor, despite my best attempts to stop it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at Granados 83 three or four times, maybe even five. We keep returning because it seems to do everything right.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location couldn't be better, especially if you enjoy fine dining. There are two very nice places less than a block away (Gresca and La Provenca) and probably another 20 or more within walking distance--of note, Fonda Gaig, Alba Granados, Paco Meralgo, Windsor--I could go on and on. And if you're not of a mind to go out for dinner, the hotel restaurant is perfectly respectable with a limited but nice menu for very reasonable prices served, depending upon the situation either in their lovely downstairs dining room or on their rooftop terrace.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides being well-located for dining, Granados 83 is in the middle of things for sight-seeing, only a couple of blocks from Passeig de Gracia, a main fashion street and the site of a couple of Gaudi's most famous buildings. It's also well located for access to transportation even though Enric Granados street itself is less-trafficked making for quiet sleeping.
reviews.title: Good time at Granados 83

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like so much of Barcelona, Granados 83 sports a super-design vibe with small but well laid out rooms, striking entry and glass elevators that let you see how the current renovation into a hotel from an earlier use took shape. Rooms are attired in dark colors but with sparkling white bathrooms with super-modern furnishings.
reviews.title: The Best Customer Service - All Around Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Staff were helpful in arranging dining reservations for us both before our arrival and after we got there and had a chance to scope out some places. The young man who tends their door and hails cabs, etc. couldn't be more friendly, smiling, welcoming and charming. And we love his signature turned up hat.
reviews.title: What a Great Surprise

VERDICT: I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend to others.
reviews.title: Impressing a hotelier is hard to do, but they did it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Granados 83 is a really great hotel. We stayed there 13-16 July and had not one problem during this time. It's in a great location in the L'Eixample district and is up the Ramblas from the heavily tourist populated Barri Gottic district (we visited here one evening but found it too hectic for a relaxing weekend in BCN and headed back to our hotel's district to relax!). We felt the area where the hotel is gave more of an insight into Barcelona life with less hustle and bustle and a lovely relaxed atmosphere in the area. The hotel has a very comfortable, trendy New York loft style. There's a great terrace bar and swimming pool on the roof which is great by day to catch some sun and enjoy a drink while relaxing and by night it's great to return up there after a meal for a night cap in the balmy night air with some cool music in the background.
reviews.title: Great service, location, and value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: FOOD: The reception and bar staff are 'very' helpful - just ask them for recommendations for where to eat and you won't be disappointed. Over the three nights we stayed we ate near the hotel. The nicest meal we had was in 'Windsor Restaurant' a few blocks from the hotel. Try the DELICIOUS gastronomique/tasting menu (€70pp incl wine) - I would say the nicest meal I've ever had! Have a drink in the Dry Martini bar near by before your meal. Very stylish place and a great way to start the evening. They have lots of different types of martinis and they also do other cocktails including a delicious Bloody Mary and beers etc. Also excellent is the more expensive (but worth it) La Dama Restaurant for fine, delicious food and excellent service (€100pp meal and wine). Finally, go to Cerveceria Catalana for excellent tapas and a wonderful atmosphere - we ate here on our first night as we were looking for something light on arrival - grab a place at the bar or wait for a table - again all three of these places are a stroll from the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Value & Location

likes.liked: — It's chic design whilst being comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall Barcelona is a great place to visit for a weekend. Do take the Tourist bus (jump on anywhere and buy a ticket) to get your barings. It's a wonderful way to see the city especially in the summer where it might be too hot for too much walking - The Parc Guell is lovely - our tip, grab a sandwich and drink on the way there (a street on the way uphill has a supermarket on the left near the top of the road). We thought in hindsight it would be nicer to grab a quiet place to sit and eat in the shade and enjoy the nice atmosphere and music playing around the park than sit at the cafes which are perfectly good but busier. Le Pedera is probably best visited earlier in the morning. We passed by in the morning and there were no queues, later in the day the queues were very long.
reviews.title: Boutique in Barca

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have a great time in Barcelona - everyone seems very friendly and are not just putting it on for the tourists - we were very impressed by the service we received from everyone!

likes.liked: — The fact that it was only 4 nights
likes.disliked: — The thin walls, loud doors, lack of attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: A hotel with genuine antiquities within reach of a 22 month olds fingers would not be my usual choice, but every member of our young family was made to feel so welcome and we were so well looked after by the absolutely delightful staff that how could we not return. The facilities and services (breakfasts, rooms etc) are all excellent and the hotel is ideal for a spot of shopping, fine dining and beach day trips out of the city. One small plea to management would be that housekeeping provide irons for use in the rooms because timings of laundry services never work for families. We loved staying at this hotel, our Catalan friends loved visiting us there and we are all planning to use the hotel again.
reviews.title: All round great relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I rented two rooms for 5 nights, one for my daughter and her husband who were in Salou for the Spanish open ballroom competition, and one for myself. We picked Granados because Fodors said it was ona quiet side steet. It was perfectly quiet, and within easy walking distance to everything except perhaps Park Guell. I paid in advance, the courteous folks at the registration desk found my reservation with no problem, spook good English and were very helpful with maps on how to navigate from the hotel, and neaby restaurants, cafes and Tapas Bars. The rooms were very clean and cozy.
reviews.title: Quiet, Courteous & Knowledgable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located, for those who like to be around Las Ramblas than it is a beautiful 15 to 20min walk. Yet for shopping u can find all the store 5min walk on the diagonal avenue...The rooms are nice and clean, although I must add that the bed are kind of short but the staff is very welcoming and helpful...
reviews.title: Nice hotel & great staff but be aware of temporary construction and back rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After booking the Hotel 1898 on the Rambla for considerably more money, we switched to Granados 83 when we discovered their much better price (about 100 euros a night plus tax, including a 15% discount for 4 or more days). The hotel is in the Exiample business district on a quiet street about 4 blocks from the upper Rambla (which is much classier than the tourist area), and only 2 blocks from 2 metro stops. Formerly a birthing center, Granados 83 (its name is its address) is ultra modern with exposed brick walls and glass hallways. The staff was very helpful and, unlike most of Barcelona, actually spoke English! Our room was not huge, but clean and efficient with all the amenities, including a "rain" shower, enormous towels and robes, and a wakeup call built into the TV. Restaurants in the area abound. The hotel's breakfast is way too expensive at 18 euros, but there are numerous outside alternatives and the staff was happy to point them out. Ask for Hugo at the front desk: he gave us exceptional service.
reviews.title: Granados 83 offers a good location, good service, and good price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at the Granados, and though we expected a fine stay we were very impressed by the staff in particular. Everyone was friendly, all spoke enough English to make us feel welcome, and the facility provided all the amenities we desired. Free, unlimited WIRED Internet (how many places offer feeble, spotty and dog slow "wireless" Internet?) Beautiful and well designed layout. Fabulous rooftop bar.
reviews.title: the staff combined with the overall package exceed my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I realize this is subjective, but in fairness and excluding the design if you do not appreciate it, the place is impeccably clean. Powerful shower, large bathrobes, climate control you can actually manipulate, and dead silent. We loved it.
reviews.title: The perfect romantic hideaway

Highly recommended, but study the web site and photos carefully. If you prefer the blandness and conformity of traditional hotel chains, stay the heck away. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE GOOD: Unlike many "design hotels," this one looks every bit as good in person as in photos. Though small, the rooms are really chic (though perhaps too masculine for some women's taste). The designers did not scrimp on materials, and it shows. Beautiful wood and wood veneer throughout. Leather and marble also used in large quantities. Great black-out shutters, too. The entire staff was extremely friendly and professional. The location is also very desireable, close to the tourist center, but not directly in it, a two block walk from the less-toursity part of Las Ramblas (Rambla de Catalunya) and a similar number of blocks from the Metro.
reviews.title: Interesting Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unlike many other hotels I have stayed in, this one looks exactly like the pictures on their website. The decor is well designed and high quality fittings have been used. The location is in easy access to the main areas yet far enough away to avoid the traffic noise.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had requested a smoking room when we booked on Lastminute.com however upon arrival we found out that the whole hotel is non smoking. The desk staff were extremely helpful and offered us the option of having a non smoking room or they would do us a good price to upgrade to a suite. We were shown both rooms and immediately took the suite.
reviews.title: Looks nice but not a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: We had room 607 which has a small balcony outside the bedroom, a mezannine floor with sofa, tv etc and opens onto a lovely terrace. The terrace is shared between 4 or 5 rooms (although we did not see anybody else out there during our 3 night stay) and has a swimming pool running along the length of it. Whilst the pool was too cold to use suring late October it was a lovely feature and made the terrace very relaxing. I can imagine during a hot summer this would be lovely for a dip after a long day walking around the city.
reviews.title: Fantastic Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All the staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful and all spoke good English.

reviews.text: I cannot comment on the food as we ate outside the hotel. The breakfast is rather expensive at 16 Euros and there are plently of places nearby to get a coffee and some breakfast and sit outside and watch the world go by.
reviews.title: just ok...

description: A superior four-star hotel located in the very heart of Barcelona, just a few minutes away on foot from Avinguda Diagonal and Passeig de Gràcia and surrounded by the city's best shopping area.Located in a former hospital from the last century, Carrer Granados number 83 was reconverted into an Art-Deco hotel establishment. Its rusted iron structure, reminiscent of the old lofts of New York’s Soho, contrasts with the stone and glass facade and with interior decoration of maximum minimalist elegance and more than a hint of Zen.Bright, elegant spaces are connected around a central patio with a skylight and a spectacular crystal covering, bringing together iron, brick, zebrawood and tamarind wood, natural leather and Thassos white marble.If you would like to stay in the centre of Barcelona and enjoy the city's most avant-garde architecture, don't hesitate to come to Hotel Granados 83.Services77 guest rooms: 5 single rooms, 6 Executive, 59 double rooms, 7 DuplexRestaurant 3G Bar8 Terrace BarBreakfast buffet24-hour room service and mini-barBusiness centreWi-Fi in all areasFunction rooms and spaces for events: Granados 83 room, multi-purpose space The Klub, 3 Restaurant, the patio of 3 Restaurant, poolside terraceOutdoor swimming pool and solariumGymParkingLaundry and ironing serviceSmall dogs allowed
